text: An IRCd, meaning Internet Relay Chat server program, is a program, server software that uses the IRC protocol. This allows people to talk to each other on the Internet. They exchange textual messages in real time. The server accepts connections from IRC clients on a group of TCP ports. When the server is part of an IRC network, it also keeps one or more connections with other servers/daemons. The word ircd once referred to only one piece of software. ==Related pages== * Comparison of Internet Relay Chat daemons ==References== ==Other websites== * irc.org - IRC resources * Technical comparison of TS and nickname delay mechanisms * DarkFire IRC Manual (network specific) * IRCd network provider *Undernet K-Line and G-Line FAQ with reasons for them, amongst other things *EFnet FAQ with several -line terms explained *Quakenet General FAQ G/K-Line *GLine, KLine, QLine and ELine syntax *
title: IRCd
